newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Flashy Austrian tycoon to stand for president.
newsitem.headline: Flashy Austrian tycoon to stand for president.

text.p: Austrian construction tycoon Richard Lugner, arguably more famous for his choice of celebrity companions to the glitzy Vienna Opera Ball than his buildings, said on Tuesday he plans to stand for president.

The stocky 64-year old, reported to have paid $40,000 for the pleasure of seeing in the New Year in the exclusive company of Britain's Duchess of York, told Die Presse's Wednesday edition he would finance his candidature with his own money.
Incumbent President Thomas Klestil's six-year term in office runs out in 1998. The presidential elections are scheduled to be held in April next year.
Lugner, ridiculed in Austrian society as a flashy parvenu, said he would campaign as an "unpolitical person from the business world" and that he was not being supported by any political grouping.
The building magnate's past ball companions include actresses Sophia Loren and Bo Derek, socialite Ivana Trump and singer Grace Jones.
